title: What is the secret energy of the mind: exploring spiritual concepts such as the body of light, intuition, and alchemy.
first_phrase: This section of the text delves deep into various symbols and concepts related to spiritual and alchemical practices. It begins with a quote from Hippocrates stating that a healthy person is one entity and cannot become sick. The section then introduces the concept of the Tibetan "body of light" and the Masonic symbol of the ruler. It also explores the importance of intuition, memorization techniques, and telepathy in these practices. The text then moves on to discuss various alchemical symbols such as the Athanor, the compass, the rose, and the color violet, among others. The section concludes with a discussion on the importance of taking action without desire, using mirrors as a technique, and the concept of "aqua permanens."

Un riferimento nel capolavoro di Marguerite Yourcenar, L’opera al nero, Feltrinelli 1969, p. 280. 109 Ad esempio nel Parzival di Wolfram von Eschenbach, parlando del re Artù: «il suo cavallo era tutto rosso, rosso l’elmo e lo scudo» (Paul-Georges Sansonetti, Graal et Alchimie, Berg International Éditeurs, Paris 1982). 110 Evola, La Tradizione Ermetica cit. Inoltre: Le viole sono ia in greco. Un testo greco, la Suda, afferma che quando Zeus condusse via Io (identificata in questo caso con Isis) da Argo la trasformò in una giovenca e per non farla riconoscere le fece cambiare tre volte il colore: prima bianca, poi nera, poi violetta. Vi è comunque un legame tra viola e rosso: le violette erano infatti ritenute simbolo della rinascita del giovane dio Attis e del sangue di Persefone dopo il suo ratto. Cfr. anche Lindsay, Le origini dell'alchimia nell'Egitto greco-romano cit. Il colore violetto è anche presente in Mantak Chia come colore supremo. 111 Stephen H. Wolinsky, The Way of the Human, III, Quantum Institute Inc., 1999, p. 144.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the practice of alchemy involves developing a deeper understanding of oneself and integrating all aspects of the self to achieve a higher state of consciousness. This process involves techniques such as mirror work, accessing the "great space" within, and developing the senses through the arts. By embracing the present moment and letting go of fear and attachment to material possessions, one can tap into the secret energy of the mind and unlock the potential for personal transformation. The path of alchemy is a lifelong journey, but one that can lead to greater self-awareness and spiritual fulfillment.
